text: "Day Tripper" is a song by English rock band the Beatles. It was released as a double A-side single with "We Can Work it Out" on 3 December 1965. This was at the same time as the band's album Rubber Soul. It was written mainly by John Lennon, but was listed as Lennon-McCartney. It was part of the first double A-side in the United Kingdom. "Day Tripper"/"We Can Work it Out" was the 7th highest selling single of the 1960s in the United Kingdom. The main part of the song is a guitar riff that Lennon wrote. He got the idea for this riff from Bobby Parker's song "Watch Your Step". ==References== ==Sources== * * * Category:The Beatles songs Category:1965 songs Category:Anne Murray songs Category:Nancy Sinatra songs Category:Cheap Trick songs Category:Jimi Hendrix songs Category:Songs about drugs
title: Day Tripper
